translated: To dispel the doubt that the covering is the location, it is said that the spread mat is the location.

original: sa la sogs pa'i gzhir rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba nyid yod na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i gzhir rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba nyid yod na /
translated: If the ground, etc. is the basis, and a spread mat of grass, etc. is spread on the ground, etc.

original: rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba de nyid de na gnas pa'i rdzas kyi phyir gnas nyid do //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba de nyid de na gnas pa'i rdzas kyi phyir gnas nyid do //
translated: That spread mat of grass, etc. is the location because it is the substance located there.

original: sa la sogs pa @108b ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa @108b ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the ground, etc.

original: de ni des bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni des bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obstructed by that.

original: skye ba ni gzhag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba ni gzhag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Birth is like the placing of something down.üîΩThe birth of grass, bushes, herbs, forests, etc. is like the theft of a placed object, for example, which is said to be stolen by merely moving it from its place.

original: rtsva dang gel pa dang / rtsi dang nags la sogs ba byung ba'i skye ba ni dper na rdzas gzhag pa bskyod pa tsam kho nas brkus par brjod par bya ba dang 'dra bar skye ba yang gnas nas bskyod pa kho nas brkus pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: rtsva dang gel pa dang / rtsi dang nags la sogs ba byung ba'i skye ba ni dper na rdzas gzhag pa bskyod pa tsam kho nas brkus par brjod par bya ba dang 'dra bar skye ba yang gnas nas bskyod pa kho nas brkus pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Birth is also said to be stolen by merely moving it from its place.

original: rtsva ba nas bton pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsva ba nas bton pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely by pulling it out of the ground.

original: 'di ltar ril gyis khyer na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ril gyis khyer na'o //
translated: For if one carries it off completely,üîΩHere the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis me tog gi shing ljon pa phyung ste //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis me tog gi shing ljon pa phyung ste //
translated: If a monk pulls up a flowering tree and steals it,

original: rku na ji srid du nom par mi byed pa'i bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku na ji srid du nom par mi byed pa'i bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: as long as he does not appraise it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nom pa nas gnas nas spos pa'i bar gyis ni brkus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nom pa nas gnas nas spos pa'i bar gyis ni brkus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: From the time of appraising it up to the time of moving it from its place, it is said to be stolen.

original: me tog gi shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog gi shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value of the flowering tree should be assessed.

original: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag la gdu bu rgyan can la sogs pa bskon pa ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag la gdu bu rgyan can la sogs pa bskon pa ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one places an ornament such as a bracelet on a limb such as the arm, how can it be determined that one has stolen it, since it is a mistake?üîΩThe text says:

original: bskon pa ni phud na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bskon pa ni phud na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one removes it, it is stolen.

original: lag pa la sogs pa la bskon pa'i rdzas ni phud na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa la bskon pa'i rdzas ni phud na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If one removes the substance placed on the arm and so on, it is stolen.

original: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag la bskon pa btags pa dang gyon zhing bgos pa ni yan lag de las phud pa phyung ba dang bkrol ba dang phral ba na de brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag la bskon pa btags pa dang gyon zhing bgos pa ni yan lag de las phud pa phyung ba dang bkrol ba dang phral ba na de brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one removes, unties, or separates an ornament such as a bracelet placed on a limb such as the arm, it should be understood that it is stolen.üîΩHere the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni de dag rgyan sna tshogs dag gis brgyan par gyur pa dge slong gis de'i sbyor bas khri las ldang ba nas gnas nas gnas gzhan du spos pa'i bar du byed na brkus zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de dag rgyan sna tshogs dag gis brgyan par gyur pa dge slong gis de'i sbyor bas khri las ldang ba nas gnas nas gnas gzhan du spos pa'i bar du byed na brkus zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk, through his own effort, removes it from the place where it was placed, up to standing from his seat, or moves it from one place to another, it is called stolen.

original: 'dir gnas nas gnas gzhan du spos pa zhes bya ba ni phud pa yin par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir gnas nas gnas gzhan du spos pa zhes bya ba ni phud pa yin par shes par bya'i /
translated: Here, ‚Äúhaving moved from one place to another‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúhaving removed.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na lag pa la sogs pa de nyid du rgyan bskon pa dpung mgo'i bar du 'khrul zhing yang phyir mkhrig ma'i bar du bskrul du rung bar zad kyi dbud par mi nus pa dag ji ltar gnas nas sbos pa tsam gyis brkus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na lag pa la sogs pa de nyid du rgyan bskon pa dpung mgo'i bar du 'khrul zhing yang phyir mkhrig ma'i bar du bskrul du rung bar zad kyi dbud par mi nus pa dag ji ltar gnas nas sbos pa tsam gyis brkus par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if it were the case that the ornament is moved from the arm to the shoulder, and then back to the wrist, it would be possible to say that it is stolen by merely moving it from one place to another.

original: de bas na lag pa la sogs pa las phud pa na brkus par 'gyur ro //üîΩsho gam rang gi gnas na 'dug pa'i phyir de ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhen de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na lag pa la sogs pa las phud pa na brkus par 'gyur ro // sho gam rang gi gnas na 'dug pa'i phyir de ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhen de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is stolen when it is removed from the arm and so on.üîΩHow is it stolen if the toll is in its own place?

original: sho gam ni sa las 'das na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sho gam ni sa las 'das na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe toll is stolen if it is moved from its place.‚Äù

original: brkus pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brkus pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äústolen‚Äù should be supplied.

original: sho gam gyi gnas ni 'dir sa zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: sho gam gyi gnas ni 'dir sa zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod de /
translated: The place of the toll is referred to by the word ‚Äúplace‚Äù here.

original: de las 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMoved from its place‚Äù means

original: sho gam gyis de @109a * //
analyzed: sho gam gyis de @109a * //
translated: the toll is moved from there.

original: las 'das pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: las 'das pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoved from there‚Äù means moved from that place.

original: sho ga ma gcod pa'i gnas ji tsam du zhugs na sho gam gzhal dgos pa nyid yin pa de ni sho gam gyi gnas yin par shas par bya ste /
analyzed: sho ga ma gcod pa'i gnas ji tsam du zhugs na sho gam gzhal dgos pa nyid yin pa de ni sho gam gyi gnas yin par shas par bya ste /
translated: The place where one must pay a toll is known as the place of toll.

original: de nyid 'dir sho gam gyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir sho gam gyis zhes bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äútoll‚Äù here.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste ;
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: sho gam gyi rdzas gzhal dgos pa'i sho gam gyi gnas su phyin la sho gam ma phul bar sho gam gyi gnas las 'das na sho gam brkus pa yin te /
analyzed: sho gam gyi rdzas gzhal dgos pa'i sho gam gyi gnas su phyin la sho gam ma phul bar sho gam gyi gnas las 'das na sho gam brkus pa yin te /
translated: If one goes to a place of toll where one must pay a toll and passes beyond the place of toll without paying the toll, one has stolen the toll.

original: 'di ltar sho gam gzhal dgos pa las 'das na yang der sho gam gyi tshad kho na brkus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sho gam gzhal dgos pa las 'das na yang der sho gam gyi tshad kho na brkus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if one passes beyond the place where one must pay the toll, one has stolen only the amount of the toll, not anything else.

original: sa de las 'das na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dir gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud ba thams cad kyang bsdus bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa de las 'das na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dir gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud ba thams cad kyang bsdus bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif one passes beyond that place‚Äù should be understood to include all the other cases.

original: 'di ltar bzhon pa glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang rang gi lus kyi rkang lag la sogs pa dang / mda' la sogs pa la btags te bskur ba'i thabs de dag gis sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i sa las 'das na yang sho gam gyi gnas de las 'das pa kho na yin no //üîΩ'di ltar de sho gam gyi sar gtogs pa yin na gal te sho gam gyi gnas su sho gam gzhal dgos par phyin nas yang phyir log gam skabs su bzur te 'gro ba de la ni yul chos gang yin pa'i khrims dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzhon pa glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang rang gi lus kyi rkang lag la sogs pa dang / mda' la sogs pa la btags te bskur ba'i thabs de dag gis sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i sa las 'das na yang sho gam gyi gnas de las 'das pa kho na yin no // 'di ltar de sho gam gyi sar gtogs pa yin na gal te sho gam gyi gnas su sho gam gzhal dgos par phyin nas yang phyir log gam skabs su bzur te 'gro ba de la ni yul chos gang yin pa'i khrims dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, when one passes through a toll station by means of an elephant, a horse, etc., or by means of one‚Äôs own feet, or by means of arrows, etc., one is still obliged to pay the toll.üîΩIf one is obliged to pay the toll at a certain place, then if one goes there and returns, or if one goes around it, one is subject to the law of that country.

original: 'di ltar yul de na gal te phyir log kyang gzhal dgos pa'i khrims su byas pa yod na ni 'das pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul de na gal te phyir log kyang gzhal dgos pa'i khrims su byas pa yod na ni 'das pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If in that country, the law is that one must pay the toll even if one returns, then one is obliged to pay the toll.

original: ji ste phyir log na gzhal mi dgos pa'i khrims su byas pa yod na ni 'das par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste phyir log na gzhal mi dgos pa'i khrims su byas pa yod na ni 'das par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the law is that one need not pay the toll if one returns, then one is not obliged to pay the toll.

original: mi ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin na de ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin na de ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If a man is endowed with coming and going, etc., how can he be a thief?

original: de'i phyir mi la gal te brdas na ni de grub na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi la gal te brdas na ni de grub na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf he is a thief by convention, then that is established.‚Äù

original: mi rku ba ni rnam pa mang du snang ste /
analyzed: mi rku ba ni rnam pa mang du snang ste /
translated: There are many kinds of non-thieves:

original: mi 'dod bzhin du bkri ba dang / gzhan pa dag gis rku ba dang / de bzhin du bsdigs pa la sogs pa dag gis rku ba dag ste /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du bkri ba dang / gzhan pa dag gis rku ba dang / de bzhin du bsdigs pa la sogs pa dag gis rku ba dag ste /
translated: those who are led unwillingly, those who are thieves by the orders of others, and those who are thieves by threats, etc.

original: de dag ni mdo 'dir ma bsams so //
analyzed: de dag ni mdo 'dir ma bsams so //
translated: But these are not considered in this s≈´tra.

original: 'dir ni gal te brdas ni zhes bya ba bsams te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gal te brdas ni zhes bya ba bsams te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúif he is a thief by convention‚Äù is considered.

original: gal te brdas mi rku bar byed na brda de grub na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te brdas mi rku bar byed na brda de grub na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If he is a thief by convention, then he is a thief when that convention is established.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te brdas rku bar byed na gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe na mi de brkus bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te brdas rku bar byed na gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe na mi de brkus bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he is a thief by convention, then when that convention is established, that man is said to be a thief.

original: 'di ltar gzhung las mi rku ba rnam pa gsum po yul phyogs dang mtshan ma dang @109b brdas rku ba gsum gsungs pa yang 'dir brda zhes smos pas gnyis kyang bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhung las mi rku ba rnam pa gsum po yul phyogs dang mtshan ma dang @109b brdas rku ba gsum gsungs pa yang 'dir brda zhes smos pas gnyis kyang bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the three types of non-stealing taught in the treatise are non-stealing by region, by sign, and by convention.  Here, convention should be understood to include the other two.

original: 'dir mi rku ba ni rang dgar phyi bzhin 'ong ba dang / khas len pa yin par dgongs pas de lta bus rku ba thams cad ni brda sngon du btang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mi rku ba ni rang dgar phyi bzhin 'ong ba dang / khas len pa yin par dgongs pas de lta bus rku ba thams cad ni brda sngon du btang ba yin no //
translated: Here, non-stealing is considered to be the voluntary relinquishment of the opportunity to steal, and all stealing is preceded by convention.

original: de la yul phyogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshogs la sogs pa'i yul yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yul phyogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshogs la sogs pa'i yul yin par gsungs so //
translated: Here, region is said to be the place of the assembly and so on.

original: mtshan ma ni brtags te skra dang kha spu bre gas nas ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni brtags te skra dang kha spu bre gas nas ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sign is the sign of a monk, such as having shaved one‚Äôs head and face and not having grown the hair long.

original: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
translated: Convention is the morning and so on.

original: mdo la sa ni brda zhes bya ba 'dan tshab sbyar ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: mdo la sa ni brda zhes bya ba 'dan tshab sbyar ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: In the sutra, the word ‚Äúconvention‚Äù is a compound word.

original: gang gi tshe khyod kyis kho bos 'di dang 'di lta bur mthong ba de'i tshe khyod kho bo'i gan du shog shig ces bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod kyis kho bos 'di dang 'di lta bur mthong ba de'i tshe khyod kho bo'i gan du shog shig ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúWhen you see that I have seen such and such, then come to me.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe mi de brkus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe mi de brkus par rig par bya'o //
translated: When that sign is established, then that person should be known as a thief.

original: gal te gsang sngags kyis drang ba la sogs pa'i thabs gzhan dag gis mi rku par byed na ni gang gi tshe snang bar gyur pa de'i tshe na brkus pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gsang sngags kyis drang ba la sogs pa'i thabs gzhan dag gis mi rku par byed na ni gang gi tshe snang bar gyur pa de'i tshe na brkus pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not steal by means of other methods, such as by mantra, then when he sees the opportunity, he should be known as a thief.

original: gal te bya rku na de la ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te bya rku na de la ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If he steals by means of a bird, how is it determined that he has stolen?

analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te de ltar na bya spar ba na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIf he steals by means of a bird, then at that time he has stolen.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf he steals in that way‚Äù means

analyzed: gal te bya spar te rku bar byed na'o //
translated: if he steals by means of a bird.

original: de'i tshe na bya spar ba na brkus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bya spar ba na brkus pa kho na yin no //
translated: At that time, when he steals by means of a bird, he has stolen.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis bya spar te rku bar byed na bya spar ba na bya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis bya spar te rku bar byed na bya spar ba na bya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text is: ‚ÄúIf a monk steals a bird, he should be made to pay the value of the bird when it is in flight.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhen it is in flight‚Äù means when it is flying away.

original: spar nas rku bar byed ces bya ba ni 'dir 'phur du bcug nas rku'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spar nas rku bar byed ces bya ba ni 'dir 'phur du bcug nas rku'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is in flight‚Äù means when it is flying away.

original: spar ba thams cad ni mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: spar ba thams cad ni mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba ste /

analyzed: btags pa ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /

original: dud 'gro btags pa ni bkrol ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dud 'gro btags pa ni bkrol ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúWhen a designated animal is released.‚Äù

original: dud 'gro btags pa rku ba ni bkrol ba na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro btags pa rku ba ni bkrol ba na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When a designated animal is stolen and released, it is stolen.

original: 'dis ni dge slong gis ri dags rlubs su chud pa phyung na ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dge slong gis ri dags rlubs su chud pa phyung na ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: This includes the statement:üîΩIf a monk rescues an animal that has fallen into a pit, he should be made to pay the value of the animal.

original: dge slong gis nya do la la thogs pa phyung na nya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dag bsdus @110a * //üîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis nya do la la thogs pa phyung na nya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dag bsdus @110a * // pa yin no //
translated: If a monk rescues a fish that is caught on a hook, he should be made to pay the value of the fish.

original: dud 'gro brtod pas sam khyu las bkar bas rku bar 'dod pa la ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: dud 'gro brtod pas sam khyu las bkar bas rku bar 'dod pa la ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If one intends to steal an animal that is tethered or that is part of a herd, how is it to be considered stolen?üîΩTherefore it is said:

analyzed: de'i phyir / brtod pa dang khyu las bkar ba ni mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: brtod pa zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro khyu'i nang na 'gro ba phur pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la btags pa'o //

original: khyu las bkar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyu las bkar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Part of a herd means

analyzed: khyu'i gnas nas logs shig tu phye ste 'das pa'o //
translated: an animal that is part of a herd is separated from the herd and moves to another place.

original: gal te dud 'gro brtod pas sam khyu las bkar bas rku bar 'dod na de la ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dud 'gro brtod pas sam khyu las bkar bas rku bar 'dod na de la ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one steals an animal by untethering it or by leading it away from the herd, how is it stolen?

original: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin gyi gnas nas bskyod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin gyi gnas nas bskyod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is stolen when it is out of sight of the owner or the herdsman, but not merely by moving it from the place where it was.

original: gal te bdag po dang rdzi bo phyi bzhin 'brang bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag po dang rdzi bo phyi bzhin 'brang bar gyur na ni /
translated: If the owner or herdsman follows it,

original: de'i tshe bdag bo dang rdzi bo las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o //üîΩgal te bdag po dang rdzi po gshed na 'dug na ni de'i tshe de las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag bo dang rdzi bo las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o // gal te bdag po dang rdzi po gshed na 'dug na ni de'i tshe de las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o //
translated: then it is stolen when it is out of sight of the owner or herdsman.üîΩIf the owner or herdsman is standing guard, then it is stolen when it is out of sight of that person.

original: gal te bdag po dang rdzi bo med na ni de'i tshe khyu las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag po dang rdzi bo med na ni de'i tshe khyu las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin te /
translated: If there is no owner or herdsman, then it is stolen when it is out of sight of the herd.

original: de ni dud 'gro rang gi ngang gis 'gro ba brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dud 'gro rang gi ngang gis 'gro ba brkus pa yin no //
translated: That is the stealing of an animal that goes by itself.

original: gang mthus bkri dgos sam sgra phyung ste brda dgos pa zhig na ni de mi snang bar gyur pa nyid du phyin kyang brkus pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang mthus bkri dgos sam sgra phyung ste brda dgos pa zhig na ni de mi snang bar gyur pa nyid du phyin kyang brkus pa ma yin te ;
translated: If it is something that must be led by force or by making a sound and giving a signal, then even if it has gone out of sight, it is not stolen.

original: ji srid du bag cha ba med pa'i yul du ma phyin tam dbang du byas par ma gyur gyi bar du brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du bag cha ba med pa'i yul du ma phyin tam dbang du byas par ma gyur gyi bar du brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: As long as it has not gone to a place where there is no danger or has not come under the control of another, it is not stolen.

original: dud 'gro smos pa ni dpe tsam ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro smos pa ni dpe tsam ste /
translated: The mention of animals is just an example.

original: 'dir mi la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu dag la yang de kho na nyid du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu dag la yang de kho na nyid du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be established in reality for humans and so on in that way.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the treatise states:

original: mig lam du snang bar ma gyur na brkus zhes bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig lam du snang bar ma gyur na brkus zhes bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that when it is not visible, it is called stolen.

original: gsang sngags dag gis gter la sogs pa la 'dren par byed na gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis gter la sogs pa la 'dren par byed na gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one leads treasures and so on with mantras, when does one steal? Therefore it is said:

original: gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Leading with mantras is when it is visible.

original: gsang sngags dag gis gter la sogs pa 'dren pa na /
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis gter la sogs pa 'dren pa na /
translated: When leading treasures and so on with mantras,

original: gter la sogs pa snang ba na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gter la sogs pa snang ba na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If a treasure and so on is visible, it is stolen.

original: 'di skad bsten te /
analyzed: 'di skad bsten te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te gter la sogs pa rang gi gnas na gnas su zin kyang de'i kha bye ba la sogs pa snang bar gyur na de'i tshe brkus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gter la sogs pa rang gi gnas na gnas su zin kyang de'i kha bye ba la sogs pa snang bar gyur na de'i tshe brkus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If a treasure and so on is in its own place, even if it is visible, it is not stolen.

original: ji ste shin tu thag ring po nas drangs te /
analyzed: ji ste shin tu thag ring po nas drangs te /
translated: But if it is drawn from a great distance,

original: rkang pa'i drung du 'ongs kyang ji srid du snang bar ma gyur na de @110b yang brkus par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i drung du 'ongs kyang ji srid du snang bar ma gyur na de @110b yang brkus par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and even if it comes to the foot of the bed, as long as it is not visible, it is not stolen.

original: grub pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no awareness of accomplishment.

original: gal te rkun ma mang po zhig yod pa las gcig kho na zhig gis gal te mthong na yang de'i tshe thams cad kyis mthong ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te rkun ma mang po zhig yod pa las gcig kho na zhig gis gal te mthong na yang de'i tshe thams cad kyis mthong ba kho na yin no //
translated: If there are many thieves, and even if only one of them sees it, at that time all of them see it.

original: 'di ltar gter la bstan pa kho na bzhin du rnam pa de lta bu rku ba gzhan dag la yang de kho na bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gter la bstan pa kho na bzhin du rnam pa de lta bu rku ba gzhan dag la yang de kho na bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained regarding treasure, so it should be established in exactly the same way for other types of stealing.

original: gom pa 'bri ba la sogs pas rku bar 'dod pa la gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gom pa 'bri ba la sogs pas rku bar 'dod pa la gang gi tshe brkus par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one wishes to steal by taking steps and so on, when does one become an actual thief?

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis nur ba dang / 'byangs pa dang / 'byam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'dzegs pa dag gis snga ma ltar yin gyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis nur ba dang / 'byangs pa dang / 'byam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'dzegs pa dag gis snga ma ltar yin gyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The two, following and accomplishing, are like the former, but they are not taken by those two.

original: snga ma ltar yin gyi zhes bya ba la snga ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga ma ltar yin gyi zhes bya ba la snga ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the former means like the former.üîΩThe former refers to the former sutra that states:üîΩStealing is taking by force or stealth.

original: mdo snga ma las gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes smos pa'i mdo de'i sngon du brtod pa dang / khyu las bkar ba gnyis ni mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes smos pa'i mdo de sngar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo snga ma las gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes smos pa'i mdo de'i sngon du brtod pa dang / khyu las bkar ba gnyis ni mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes smos pa'i mdo de sngar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The two, tying and dragging, are not visible, but they are like the former sutra that states:üîΩStealing is taking by force or stealth.

original: snga ma de las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na zhes smos pa de lta ra mi snang ba nyid du gyur na 'dir yang brkus ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma de las mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na zhes smos pa de lta ra mi snang ba nyid du gyur na 'dir yang brkus ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase when it becomes invisible refers to the former. When it becomes invisible in this way, it is also called stolen.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //üîΩgang dag mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no // gang dag mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: When it becomes invisible, it is stolen.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyis zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is it that becomes invisible? Therefore, it is said, the two: following and accomplishing.

original: phyi bzhin 'gro ba dang chos gos la sogs pa 'bul bar byed pa de gnyis so //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'gro ba dang chos gos la sogs pa 'bul bar byed pa de gnyis so //
translated: These are the two: following and offering robes, etc.

original: thabs gang dag gis de gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs gang dag gis de gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what means do these two become invisible? Therefore, it is said,

original: nur ba dang 'byangs pa la sogs pas yin gyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nur ba dang 'byangs pa la sogs pas yin gyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: by means of deception, by means of skill, etc., but not by means of their acceptance.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa de gnyis blangs ba'i rdzas de mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na ni brkus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par byed pa de gnyis blangs ba'i rdzas de mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na ni brkus pa ma yin te /
translated: If the object that they took is not visible to them, then it is not stolen.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe na de gnyis la rdzas de brkus pa'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang de'i tshe na gnas nas spo ba'i mtshams las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe na de gnyis la rdzas de brkus pa'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang de'i tshe na gnas nas spo ba'i mtshams las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, even though they have the intention to steal that object, they have not yet passed beyond the boundary of the place where it is kept.

original: 'di ltar dang po'i gom pa phyir bsnur ba'i dus kho na na rdzas mchan na 'dug pa de brkus par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po'i gom pa phyir bsnur ba'i dus kho na na rdzas mchan na 'dug pa de brkus par gyur te /
translated: Thus, the moment they take the first step away, the object in the hole is stolen.

original: rdzas de mi snang ba nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩde ltar mi bzhed de de bas na phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par @111a * //
analyzed: rdzas de mi snang ba nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na / de ltar mi bzhed de de bas na phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang / sgrub par @111a * //
translated: Because the object is no longer visible to them.

original: byed pa gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid brkus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid brkus pa yin gyi /
translated: This is not accepted, so the two, following and accomplishing, are not visible to them.

original: de gnyis kyis blangs pa'i rdzas mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na ni brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis blangs pa'i rdzas mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na ni brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: The object that they took is not stolen when it is not visible to them.

original: de gnyis mi snang ba nyid du gyur pa'i thabs kyi tshig de dag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis mi snang ba nyid du gyur pa'i thabs kyi tshig de dag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of those words of method for making those two disappear should be explained.

original: nur ba zhes bya ba ni gom pa phyi phyir 'bri zhing phyi nur du 'gro ba'o //üîΩ'byangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyir lus pa ste /
analyzed: nur ba zhes bya ba ni gom pa phyi phyir 'bri zhing phyi nur du 'gro ba'o // 'byangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyir lus pa ste /
translated: Retreating means going backward, taking steps backward.

original: rdzas kyi bdag po'i mdun nas phyir nur te song ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag po'i mdun nas phyir nur te song ba'o //
translated: Relaxed means turning away, turning away from the presence of the owner of the substance.

original: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis de nyid du mi snang ba'am /üîΩgzugs gzhan du bsgyur ba la sogs pa yang 'dis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis de nyid du mi snang ba'am / gzugs gzhan du bsgyur ba la sogs pa yang 'dis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: By means of mantra and medicine, one should understand that it is included in making it invisible right there, or transforming it into another form.

original: 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba ste /
analyzed: 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba ste /
translated: Moving means abandoning the place.

original: 'di lta ste gshong nas thang la phyung ba dang / thang las gshong du 'bab pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa nas thibs por 'jug pa dang / thibs po nas mngon par skabs yod par 'gro ba dang / gnas khang nas khyams su dang /

translated: For example, it is like taking it out of a pit onto the plain, taking it from the plain into a pit, from an open place into a thicket, from a thicket into an open place, from a house onto a courtyard, from a courtyard into a house, from a village into the wilderness, from the wilderness into a village, from a road onto a non-road, from a non-road onto a road, from a high place to a low place, from a low place to a high place, from a mountain to a mountain, from a mountain to a plain, from a plain to a mountain, from a forest to a forest, from a forest to a plain, from a plain to a forest, from a river to a river, from a river to the ocean, from the ocean to a river, from a lake to a lake, from a lake to the ocean, from the ocean to a lake, from a pond to a pond, from a pond to the ocean, from the ocean to a pond, from a spring to a spring, from a spring to the ocean, from the ocean to a spring, from a cloud to a cloud, from a cloud to the ocean, from the ocean to a cloud, from a mirage to a mirage, from a mirage to the ocean, from the ocean to a mirage, from a city to a city, from a city to the ocean, from the ocean to a city, from a village to a village, from a village to the ocean, from the ocean to a village, from a house to a house, from a house to the ocean, from the ocean to a house, from a courtyard to a courtyard, from a courtyard to the ocean, from the ocean to a courtyard, from a forest to a forest, from a forest to the ocean, from the ocean to a forest, from a mountain to a mountain, from a mountain to the ocean, from the ocean to a mountain, from a plain to a plain, from a plain to the ocean, from the ocean to a plain

original: khyams nas gnas khang du dang / yang tog nas yang tog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang / yang tog nas yang tog gzhan du 'bab pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyams nas gnas khang du dang / yang tog nas yang tog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang / yang tog nas yang tog gzhan du 'bab pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moving from the courtyard to the house, climbing from one roof to another, descending from one roof to another, entering the courtyard from the house, going from the courtyard to the outer wall, and so on.

original: de dag thams cad ni 'byam pa'i sgras bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni 'byam pa'i sgras bsdus pa yin no //
translated: All of these are included in the term ‚Äúmoving.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang du'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Entering‚Äù means entering the house.

original: 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni yang tog gzhan du 'dzeg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni yang tog gzhan du 'dzeg pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Climbing‚Äù means climbing from one roof to another.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: nur ba la sogs pa de dag gis phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: nur ba la sogs pa de dag gis phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: If the two, the follower and the one who accomplishes, are not seen by those who move and so on, then it should be known that it is stolen.

original: de gnyis kyis blangs pa'i rdzas mi snang ba nyid du gyur na ni brkus pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de gnyis kyis blangs pa'i rdzas mi snang ba nyid du gyur na ni brkus pa ma yin no ;
translated: If the substance that they took is not seen, then it is not stolen.

original: /'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon lam gyis bgrod par zhugs pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na de la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa bsri bas 'gro zhing spyang 'brang du 'gro na gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon lam gyis bgrod par zhugs pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na de la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa bsri bas 'gro zhing spyang 'brang du 'gro na gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, the text reads as follows: ‚ÄòWhen the preceptors and teachers who have set out on the path entrust their robes to their students and pupils, the latter may harbor thoughts of theft and walk away with them, taking them on a walk. In that case, they commit an offense of wrong conduct for every step they take.

original: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as the robes remain within sight, they commit a serious offense.

original: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur na brkus par brjod par bya ste /
translated: When they are no longer within sight, the robes are considered stolen.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: The value of the robes should be assessed.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag gis rku sems kyis slob dpon dang @111b mkhan po dag gi chos gos dag rku bar byed cing de dag gis de dag khyer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag gis rku sems kyis slob dpon dang @111b mkhan po dag gi chos gos dag rku bar byed cing de dag gis de dag khyer te /
translated: In this way, students and pupils may steal the robes of their teachers and preceptors with thoughts of theft. If they carry the robes away,

original: gshong nas thang la 'byung ba ni nyen kor du khyer pa yin yang de la de dag gis rku sems nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gshong nas thang la 'byung ba ni nyen kor du khyer pa yin yang de la de dag gis rku sems nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And if one takes it from a pit to the plain, it is carried to the vicinity, but they say that the thought of stealing is present.üîΩ

original: gnas khang la sogs ba nas khyams la sogs par 'gro ba dang ; de nas der 'gro ba dang / der 'jug pa na ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs ba nas khyams la sogs par 'gro ba dang ; de nas der 'gro ba dang / der 'jug pa na ji ltar brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one emerges from a pit onto the ground, or from the ground into a pit, or from a field into a threshing floor, or from a threshing floor into a field, or from a house into a courtyard, or from a courtyard into a house, and so on, and if one goes from there to there, and enters there, how does one become a thief?

original: der rkun po mi snang bar gyur pa kho na na mthar thug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: der rkun po mi snang bar gyur pa kho na na mthar thug par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that one becomes a thief when one is out of sight of the owner.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: gru ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gru ji ltar brkus par rnam par gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
translated: How is it determined that one becomes a thief through a boat?

original: gru ni skam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩskam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba ni /
analyzed: gru ni skam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te / skam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba ni /
translated: The verse text states, ‚ÄúA boat is by land, a canal, and open water.‚ÄùüîΩLand, a canal, and open water are

original: skam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba dag go //
analyzed: skam sa dang yur po che dang chu bdal ba dag go //
translated: land, a canal, and open water.

original: de bas na de dag gis gru de rku ba'i bsam pas mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis gru de rku ba'i bsam pas mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, when the boat is stolen by those who intend to steal it, it is stolen when it disappears from sight.

original: de ni dpe ste shing dang snod la sogs pa thams cad la yang cho ga de bzhin no ;
analyzed: de ni dpe ste shing dang snod la sogs pa thams cad la yang cho ga de bzhin no ;
translated: This is the example. The same rule applies to all trees, vessels, etc.üîΩHow is it stolen in a great river?

original: / chu klung chen po dag tu ji ltar brkus bar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: / chu klung chen po dag tu ji ltar brkus bar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rgyun phyogs kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyun phyogs kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚Äúin the direction of the current.‚Äù

original: rgyun 'bab pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni rgyun phyogs so //
analyzed: rgyun 'bab pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni rgyun phyogs so //

translated: This refers to the goods of others that are not to be made one‚Äôs own by any means other than by the permission of the owner, such as the goods of a caravan that have been robbed by thieves, the goods in a cemetery that are owned by no one, the goods in a temple, the goods of a deity, and so on.

translated: One should not make them one‚Äôs own by any means other than by the permission of the owner, such as by saying, ‚ÄúThis is a discarded rag,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is mine because I built this temple.‚Äù

original: bdag gir thob par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir thob par mi bya'o //

analyzed: bdag gir byas pa dgug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: rkun po la sogs pa gzhan gyi rdzas gang yin pa rku 'phrog la sogs pas bdag gir bsgrubs pa ste /

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pas thob pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bdag gir byas pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na rdzas mi bdog pa las / rku 'phrog pa la sogs pas rang nyid kyir bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gir byas pa zhes grags pa yin te /

analyzed: bdag gir byed pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: byin len la sogs pas thob pa gang yin pa de la ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la ltos pa yang yod pas /

analyzed: des na 'dir rku 'phrog la sogs pas bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa de kho na @118b bdag gir byas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here, whatever is appropriated by means of theft, robbery, etc., should be understood as appropriated by that.

original: dgug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dgug pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la gsol pa la sogs pa'i nan khugs kyis 'gugs pa la bya'i /

original: nyo ba la sogs pas 'gugs pa la ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: nyo ba la sogs pas 'gugs pa la ni mi bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar nyo ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas gnang bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir ni rang gi 'du shes kyis 'gugs pa de dgag par mdzad kyi /
translated: Here, summoning by one‚Äôs own perception is prohibited.

analyzed: gzhan gyir 'du shes pas 'gugs pa ni sngar pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: But summoning by the perception of another is taught as a downfall, etc., above.

analyzed: de bas na rang gir 'du shes pas rang gi rdzas nan khugs kyis 'gugs par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gis gzhan gyis bdag gir byas pa dgug par mi bya ste /

original: de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: gang gis phrogs pa des rdzas de bdag gir byas pa'i phyir de'i bdag gir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rab tu byung bas de la mi 'dod bzhin du nan khugs kyis dbrog pa de ni rigs pa'i tshul ma yin te /

original: de bas na 'dir brkus par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba yod pas bkag pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir brkus par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba yod pas bkag pa ni ma yin gyi /

original: 'di ltar rab tu byung ba'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin bas dgag par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byung ba'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin bas dgag par mdzad do //
translated: Rather, it is prohibited because it is not in accord with the way of life of one who has gone forth.

original: gal te nan khugs kyis dgug par mi bya na /
analyzed: gal te nan khugs kyis dgug par mi bya na /
translated: If one should not summon it by force,

original: de la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: then how should one proceed?

original: de ni chos bshad pas bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni chos bshad pas bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: rdzas phrogs pa de ni dge slong gis chos bshad pas bslang bar bya'o //

original: rin phyed du nye bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rin phyed du nye bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

original: rin phyed du nye bas kyang blu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rin phyed du nye bas kyang blu bar bya'o //

original: nye ba zhes bya ba ni khad nye ba'i tshig ste /üîΩrin phyed du cung zad ma chog pa'am /
analyzed: nye ba zhes bya ba ni khad nye ba'i tshig ste / rin phyed du cung zad ma chog pa'am /

analyzed: phyed pas cung zad lhag pas kyang blu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni rin chen pos blugs kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni rin chen pos blugs kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A bowl and robes should be restored even by their value.

original: gal te des chos bshad pa'i thabs kyis kyang ma khugs na de'i tshe lhung bzed dang chos gos phrogs pa'i rdzas ni rin chen pos blugs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te des chos bshad pa'i thabs kyis kyang ma khugs na de'i tshe lhung bzed dang chos gos phrogs pa'i rdzas ni rin chen pos blugs kyang rung ste /
translated: If the stolen property is not restored by teaching the Dharma, then the bowl and robes should be restored even by their value.

original: de ni kha bsgyur ba'i las la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni kha bsgyur ba'i las la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the purpose of teaching the Dharma is to eliminate the afflictions of the act of stealing, etc.

original: mi snyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bor ba'o zhes skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum du ma bab par bskur bar ni bya'o zhes @119a * //üîΩbya ba ni /üîΩdngos po gang las 'di nyid kyis 'di bsad do //
analyzed: mi snyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bor ba'o zhes skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum du ma bab par bskur bar ni bya'o zhes @119a * // bya ba ni / dngos po gang las 'di nyid kyis 'di bsad do //
translated: The unpleasant should be discarded means that one should not proclaim it in the presence of many people.

original: 'di nyid kyis 'di brkus so zhes bya ba'i mi snyan pa mi mdzes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bden du bor ba nyid yin na yang 'di bor ba'o zhes bdag gis nges par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis 'di brkus so zhes bya ba'i mi snyan pa mi mdzes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni bden du bor ba nyid yin na yang 'di bor ba'o zhes bdag gis nges par bya ste /
translated: The meaning is: I will definitely say, 'This is discarded,' even if it is true that unpleasant and unseemly things will arise from this, such as 'This one killed this one,' 'This one stole this one,' and so on.

original: skyi bo phal po che su'i yang mngon sum du ma bab par dge slong gis bskur bar mi bya blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyi bo phal po che su'i yang mngon sum du ma bab par dge slong gis bskur bar mi bya blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de ni ma dad pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma dad pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it eliminates lack of faith.

original: skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum zhes smos pas ni nyes pa 'di mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum zhes smos pas ni nyes pa 'di mi 'byung ste /
translated: By stating in the presence of many people, this fault does not arise.

original: de ltar drug sde dag gis rkun po rnams kyis phag gi mgo bcad de bor ba phyag dar khrod do zhes blangs pa dang / tshol ba'i mi rnams kyis de dag la 'phags pa dag ji lta drang srong gi rgyal mtshan thogs shing bya ba 'di lta bu yang byed ces smras pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar drug sde dag gis rkun po rnams kyis phag gi mgo bcad de bor ba phyag dar khrod do zhes blangs pa dang / tshol ba'i mi rnams kyis de dag la 'phags pa dag ji lta drang srong gi rgyal mtshan thogs shing bya ba 'di lta bu yang byed ces smras pa nas /
translated: People searching for the pig's head said to them, Aryas, why do you hold the banner of a sage and do such things?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

analyzed: dge slong gis phyag dar khrod de lta bu skye bo phal bo che'i mngon sum du ma bab par blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Monks should not take such charnel ground articles in the presence of many people.

original: len na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs ba yin no //
analyzed: len na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs ba yin no //

original: ro'i rdzas 'di ltar mi ma yin pas blangs par gyur na 'on kyang de'i ma yin no //
analyzed: ro'i rdzas 'di ltar mi ma yin pas blangs par gyur na 'on kyang de'i ma yin no //
translated: The substance of a corpse is taken by non-humans, but it is not theirs.

original: snyam pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyam pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ro'i rdzas mi ma yin pas blangs pa nyid ni yongs su ma bzung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The substance of a corpse taken by non-humans is not unowned.

analyzed: mi ma yin pas yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de dur khrod de nyid du bskyal bar bya dgos na /

analyzed: der ji ltar 'gro bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /

original: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: mi ma yin pa rab tu gtum pa 'khrugs pa de'i phyi bzhin du dge slong 'gro bar bya ste /

original: de ni gnod pa byed pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnod pa byed pa spang ba'i phyir ro //

original: dur khrod der khyer nas rdzas de mi ma yin pa de'i steng du ji ltar g-yogs bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dur khrod der khyer nas rdzas de mi ma yin pa de'i steng du ji ltar g-yogs bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If the substance is carried to that charnel ground, how should that substance be placed over that non-human being?

original: khas spub tu bsnyal pa la rkang ba'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khas spub tu bsnyal pa la rkang ba'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He should cover the corpse with the cloth that was used to wrap it, beginning from the feet.

analyzed: ro bsnyal ba la ro'i rdzas kyis g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: ji ltar bsnyal ba la g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bsnyal ba la g-yogs par bya zhe na de'i phyir /

analyzed: khas spub tu bsnyal ba la zhes @119b bya ba smos te / kha sa la bstan te ltos bsnyal ba la /

analyzed: de'i steng nas des blangs pa'i la ba la sogs pas g-yogs par bya'o //

original: ji ltar g-yogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar g-yogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be covered?

original: de'i phyir / rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: He should cover the corpse with the cloth that was used to wrap it, beginning from the feet.

original: rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te mgor thug gi bar du mas yar mthar gyis g-yogs par bya'i /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te mgor thug gi bar du mas yar mthar gyis g-yogs par bya'i /
translated: The corpse should be covered with the cloth that was used to wrap it, beginning from the feet and ending at the head.

original: gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: Not otherwise,

original: de yang gnod pa byed pa spang ba kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gnod pa byed pa spang ba kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is only for the purpose of avoiding harm.

original: ro ma smas pa la mi ma yin pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i skabs yod pas de'i rdzas blangs pa las nyes dmigs de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ro ma smas pa la mi ma yin pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i skabs yod pas de'i rdzas blangs pa las nyes dmigs de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /

original: ma smas pa las blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya pa smras te /
analyzed: ma smas pa las blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya pa smras te /
translated: To eliminate that, it is said: ‚ÄúDo not take from an undamaged one.‚Äù

original: ro ma smas pa las rdzas blangs bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ro ma smas pa las rdzas blangs bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not take substances from an undamaged corpse.

original: 'o na ci ste de lta na rang gis smas par byas te 'am /
analyzed: 'o na ci ste de lta na rang gis smas par byas te 'am /
translated: But if it is like that, then one might think, ‚ÄúI will damage it myself,

original: gzhan sman par byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: gzhan sman par byed du bcug ste /
translated: or I will have another do it.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rang gis smas pa dang smas par byed du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis smas pa dang smas par byed du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúDo not damage it yourself or have it damaged.‚Äù

original: 'dir ro zhes bya ba mtha' gnyi gar sbyar te ro de rang gis kyang smas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ro zhes bya ba mtha' gnyi gar sbyar te ro de rang gis kyang smas par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúcorpse‚Äù is applied to both ends. Do not damage that corpse yourself.

analyzed: ro de gzhan yang smas par byed du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That corpse should not be damaged by another. This is the meaning.

original: thams cad du so shing la sogs pa yang ma bstabs kyi bar du blang bar mi bya'o snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du so shing la sogs pa yang ma bstabs kyi bar du blang bar mi bya'o snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel doubt, the text says:

analyzed: bsti gnas nyid du so shing dang chu dang 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dang sa ci ba der bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One should use tooth cleaners, water, cleaning sticks, cow dung and earth in the very same place where one is staying.

original: bsti gnas nyid du dge slong gis so shing la sogs pa ci bder bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsti gnas nyid du dge slong gis so shing la sogs pa ci bder bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply this to the statement: A monk should use tooth cleaners and so on as he pleases in the very same place where he is staying.üîΩHere the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gang du bsti ba der rnam pa lnga po dag ci bder byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gang du bsti ba der rnam pa lnga po dag ci bder byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: A monk should use the five articles as he pleases in the very same place where he is staying.

original: so shing dang chu dang 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dang sa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
